text:
Essential Skills for a Changing Planet



Given the rapid pace of global environmental change, proficiency in Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and remote sensing (RS) is becoming a highly sought-after skillset within and beyond academia.Especially cross-disciplinary knowledge sharing in cutting-edge techniques has high relevance to address environmental challenges.

Research & Innovation

title: A UiB collaborative platform for GIS/RS methods
text:
A UiB collaborative platform for GIS/RS methods
Join a growing community of researchers and students from diverse academic backgrounds united by a shared interest in Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and Remote Sensing (RS).
Through seminars, workshops, and conferences, participants have the opportunity to present their work, engage in meaningful discussions, and explore innovative applications of GIS and RS in tackling today‚Äôs environmental challenges.
Our network currently brings together 55 active members from the University of Bergen (UiB), spanning the Departments of Earth Science, Biology, Geography, Physics, and Archaeology‚Äîrepresenting three faculties.
We are also proud to have established a strong collaborative partnership with the Theoretical and Computational Ecology group at the University of Amsterdam (UvA), expanding our reach and impact across institutions.
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential participation and projects.
